cropsPage.title: Crop Information
cropsPage.subtitle: Comprehensive cultivation guides for various crops across India with state-wise recommendations

crops.name: Rice (Paddy)
crops.description: Rice is the staple food crop of India. It requires high water and temperature for cultivation.
crops.cultivation: Prepare land by plowing. Transplant seedlings at 20-25 days. Maintain water level at 5-7 cm.

crops.name: Wheat
crops.description: Wheat is the second most important cereal crop in India after rice.
crops.cultivation: Sow seeds in rows. Apply fertilizers at sowing and tillering stages. Irrigate 4-6 times.

crops.name: Cotton
crops.description: Cotton is the most important fiber crop and cash crop in India.
crops.cultivation: Deep plowing required. Sow seeds at 45-60 cm spacing. Apply fertilizers in splits.

crops.name: Sugarcane
crops.description: Sugarcane is a major cash crop used for sugar production.
crops.cultivation: Plant setts in furrows. Maintain adequate moisture. Apply fertilizers regularly.

crops.name: Maize
crops.description: Maize is an important cereal crop used for food, feed, and industrial purposes.
crops.cultivation: Sow seeds at proper spacing. Apply balanced fertilizers. Control weeds timely.

crops.name: Pulses (Gram)
crops.description: Gram (chickpea) is an important pulse crop rich in protein.
crops.cultivation: Sow seeds with seed treatment. Requires minimal irrigation. Apply phosphorus fertilizers.
